intro: Tridens nealleyi, commonly known as the Nealley's trident, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-parted leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
